مقابلة مع آمنة أسعد حمد

oai_dc:dc.dc:otherSubject: Daughters; Handicrafts; Horses; Kings; Magic objects; Marriage; Socio-economic conditions; Sons; Storms; Wisdom; Wives; Beheading; Food; Gold; Hell; Jinn; Landowners; Loggers; Machination; Magic objects; Marriage; Money; Orphans; Princes; Sexual harassment; Shepherds; Socio-economic conditions; al-Shāṭir Ḥasan; Arranged marriage; Brothers; Child killings; Chores; Coffeehouses; Cousins; Disguise; Family reunification; Hospitality; Hunting; Hyenas; Leaving; Machination; Magic; Marital abandonment; Marriage; Medical care; Public baths; Sisters; Social norms; Trade; Travel; Arranged marriage; Birds; Burial; Child killings; Childbirth; Children; Diseases; Dispersion; Engagement; Loved ones; Magic; Marital Abandonment; Mothers; Ogres; Qarīnah; Return; Sit Bdūr; Wedding celebration; ʻAtābā
oai_dc:dc.dc:biography: The interview was recorded on April, 1997 with Āminah As‘ad Ḥamad, female, born in 1912 in al-Sumayrīyah, Palestine and resides in ʻAyn al-Ḥilwah Palestinian Refugee Camp, Lebanon.
oai_dc:dc.dc:biographyAR: سجلت المقابلة مع آمنة أسعد حمد في نيسان أبريل عام 1997، أنثى، ولدت عام 1912 في السُمَيريّة، فلسطين وتقيم في مخيم عين الحلوة للاجئين الفلسطينيين، لبنان.
oai_dc:dc.dc:toc: The King and his Daughter story. (@ 0:00)
